intro: Tribulus terrestris var. medius, commonly known as punctate bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a low-growing annual or perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, hard seeds, aiding in its widespread distribution.
